issue.title: weird column names in occ_search
issue.body:
When using `occ_search` I get back some weird column names. 

```
X.99d66b6c.9087.452f.a9d4.f15f2c2d0e7e.
```

I don't think this is desirable...

comment.body:
Network keys appear to be getting into the column names. 

https://api.gbif.org/v1/occurrence/212156219

commits.message: Deploying to gh-pages from @ ropensci/osmextract@05221d402ea3fb74d3700246e50f64e472475fcb 🚀

pull_request.title: Revamp tests
pull_request.body:
Revamp the existing tests using the so-called test fixtures: https://testthat.r-lib.org/articles/test-fixtures.html

The main benefit of the new approach is that each test is explicitly run in a clean and independent session (so each time the PBF file is copied to the `tempdir()` and removed at the end of the test). That helped me a lot to detect problems in the old version of the tests. The main con is that this might be extremely difficult to modify in a few months, let's see 😅

pull_request.title: Remove unnecessary unlink to avoid warnings in R 4.2
pull_request.body:
## Description
On R 4.2 `geojson::geojson_read` is returning a warning for all files

```
Warning (test-geojson_read.R:10:3): geojson_read works with file inputs
expanded path length 35145 would be too long for
list(list(list(c(-120.248484, -120.247393, -120.238657, -120.230001, -120.221287, -120.208478, -120.19578, -120.167306, -120.151663, -120.147647, -120.140362, -120.135853, -120.115058, -120.090182, -120.073609, -120.062778, -120.061953, -120.057637, -120.055107, -120.043259, -120.044004, -120.047798, -120.050382, -120.048926, -120.046575, -120.041311, -120.025653, -120.011123, -120.003815, -119.984316, -119.978876, -119.979913, -119.976857, -119.971141, -119.97026, -119.973691, -120.00096, -120.017715, 
-120.046881, -120.048315, -120.048611, -120.049682, -120.077793, -120.098601, -120.105489, -120.109137, -120.121817, -120.168974, -120.179049, -120.18984, -120.192339, -120.198602, -120.200085, -120.209372, -120.224461, -120.248484, 33.999329, 34.001911, 34.007592, 34.010136, 34.010367, 34.005655, 34.004284, 34.008219, 34.018126, 34.024831, 34.025974, 34.026087, 34.019866, 34.019806, 34.024477, 34.031161, 34.033976, 34.03734, 34.037729, 3 [... truncated]
Backtrace:
 1. geojsonio::geojson_read(file)
      at test-geojson_read.R:10:2
 2. geojsonio::geojson_read.character(file)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:89:2
 3. geojsonio::read_json(...)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:101:2
 4. geojsonio::file_to_list(x, stringsAsFactors, parse, ...)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:133:2
 5. geojsonio::tosp_list(input, stringsAsFactors, parse, ...)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:144:2
 6. geojsonio::sf2list(tosp_base(x, stringsAsFactors, ...), parse)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:179:2
 7. base::unlink(x)
      at geojsonio/R/geojson_read.R:179:2
```

Looking at the PR which added this `unlink` call https://github.com/ropensci/geojsonio/commit/3dbd4c8da07dceda3517a0bac107e004c208ada8#diff-8612e05a9f8ba5a657c0697ef0ec3a3bd59277ff8a2220d4b277ad8b9942c688R119 I think this was meant to be called on the tempfile `tfile`.

## Related Issue
None

## Example
file <- system.file("examples", "california.geojson", package = "geojsonio")
aa <- geojson_read(as.location(file))

No test here - I can write an explicit test to check that the warning about "expanded path length" is not raised if it would be helpful.

issue.title: Can not see uploaded file
issue.body:
First, thank you for the package, it will help me a lot for my quest of reproducible science.
I created a repo to experiment with `piggyback`: https://github.com/PMassicotte/learn-piggyback/releases/tag/v0.1.5. I am using the following code to upload a simple CSV file.

``` r
library(piggyback)

pb_new_release(tag = "v0.1.5", repo = "PMassicotte/learn-piggyback/")
#> ✔ Created new release "v0.1.5".

tmpfile <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv.gz")
readr::write_csv(mtcars, tmpfile)

pb_upload(tmpfile, repo = "PMassicotte/learn-piggyback/")
#> ℹ Uploading 'file841a2b175d0a.csv.gz' ...
#>   |                                                                              |                                                                      |   0%  |                                                                              |======================================================================| 100%
```
However, I can not see the file in any of the test release I created. Maybe I missed something?

Thanks in advance for any guidance.

Philippe

<sup>Created on 2022-05-18 by the [reprex package](https://reprex.tidyverse.org) (v2.0.1)</sup>
